docs.lead_paragraph: FEW events can chew up and spit out a weekend afternoon quite like a baby shower: the peak tanning hours of a glorious summer Saturday are spent not on the beach, but indoors, nibbling bland sandwiches and oohing over splashproof storybooks. For Pixie Yates, a fashion designer, her friends rebelled against the stereotype. Kendall Meade, a rock musician, and Katie Gentempo, a fashion stylist, commandeered Patio, an indoor-outdoor bar in the East Village owned by Ms. Yates's husband, Jimmy Carbone, and called in a dozen friends to toast Ms. Yates's pregnancy with sangria, Champagne and a Mediterranean buffet of crab cakes, spanakopita and sandwiches.

headline.main: Downtown, Welcoming Baby With Many Stylists

docs.abstract: Scene at baby shower given by rock musician Kendall Meade and fashion stylist Katie Gentempo for Pixie Yates at Patio, in East Village, described; photos (Good Company column) (M)
docs.snippet: FEW events can chew up and spit out a weekend afternoon quite like a baby shower: the peak tanning hours of a glorious summer Saturday are spent not on the beach, but indoors, nibbling bland sandwiches and oohing over splashproof storybooks.    For...

docs.lead_paragraph: In a dangerous boomerang effect apparently caused by antibiotics, E. coli is on the rise among premature babies and has overtaken strep as the most common infection in such infants, a new study suggests. The shift is worrisome because E. coli bacteria can be more deadly than streptococcus germs.

headline.main: Rise in E. Coli Is Found in Premature Infants

docs.abstract: National Institutes of Health study finds E coli is on rise among premature babies, overtaking streptococcus as most common infection; shift is worrisome because E coli can be more deadly than strep; researchers say ampicillin, antibiotic commonly used to wipe out strep in pregnant women, apparently gives E coli room to flourish; results are published in New England Journal of Medicine (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.
docs.abstract: In this lesson, students examine the basic structure of the United Nations Population Fund. They then assume the roles of various parties involved in the United States' funding of the Population Fund to gain an understanding of the current administration's policy toward this organization.
